cgi.auth_password.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.AUTH_PASSWORD

cgi.auth_type.body: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, the protocol-specific authentication method used to validate the user.

cgi.cert_flags.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.CERT_FLAGS

cgi.cert_issuer.body: Information about the authority that provided the client certificate, for example:O = "VeriSign, Inc.", OU = VeriSign Trust Network, OU = "www.verisign.com/repository/RPA Incorp. By Ref.,LIAB.LTD(c)98", CN = VeriSign Class 1 CA Individual Subscriber-Persona Not Validated

cgi.cert_keysize.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.CERT_KEYSIZE

cgi.cert_secretkeysize.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.CERT_SECRETKEYSIZE

cgi.cert_serialnumber.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.CERT_SERIALNUMBER

cgi.cert_server_issuer.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.CERT_SERVER_ISSUER

cgi.cert_server_subject.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.CERT_SERVER_SUBJECT

cgi.cert_subject.body: Client-specific information provided by the web server. This data typically includes the client's name, e-mail address, and so on, for example:O = "VeriSign, Inc.", OU = VeriSign Trust Network, OU = "www.verisign.com/repository/RPA Incorp. by Ref.,LIAB.LTD(c)98", OU = Persona Not Validated, OU = Digital ID Class 1 - Microsoft, CN = Matthew Lund, E = mlund@.com

cgi.cf_template_path.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.CF_TEMPLATE_PATH

cgi.content_length.body: Length of the content as given by the client.

cgi.content_type.body: For queries that have attached information, such as HTTP POST and PUT, this is the content type of the data.

cgi.context_path.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.CONTEXT_PATH

cgi.gateway_interface.body: CGI specification revision with which this server complies. Format: CGI/revision.

cgi.http_accept.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTP_ACCEPT

cgi.http_accept_encoding.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTP_ACCEPT_ENCODING

cgi.http_accept_language.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE

cgi.http_connection.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTP_CONNECTION

cgi.http_cookie.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTP_COOKIE

cgi.http_host.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTP_HOST

cgi.http_if_modified_since.body: The last time the page was modified. The browser determines whether to set this variable, usually in response to the server having sent the LAST_MODIFIED HTTP header. It can be used to take advantage of browser-side caching.

cgi.http_referer.body: The referring document that linked to or submitted form data.

cgi.http_user_agent.body: The browser that the client is currently using to send the request. Format: software/version library/version.

cgi.https.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTPS

cgi.https_keysize.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTPS_KEYSIZE

cgi.https_secretkeysize.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTPS_SECRETKEYSIZE

cgi.https_server_issuer.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTPS_SERVER_ISSUER

cgi.https_server_subject.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.HTTPS_SERVER_SUBJECT

cgi.local_addr.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.LOCAL_ADDR

cgi.local_host.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.LOCAL_HOST

cgi.path_info.body: Extra path information, as given by the client. Scripts can be accessed by their virtual pathname, followed by extra information at the end of this path. The extra information is sent as PATH_INFO.

cgi.path_translated.body: Translated version of PATH_INFO after any virtual-to-physical mapping.

cgi.query_string.body: Query information that follows the ? in the URL that referenced this script.

cgi.remote_addr.body: IP address of the remote host making the request.

cgi.remote_host.body: Hostname making the request. If the server does not have this information, it sets REMOTE_ADDR and does not set REMOTE_HOST.

cgi.remote_ident.body: If the HTTP server supports RFC 931 identification, this variable is set to the remote username retrieved from the server. Use this variable for logging only.

cgi.remote_user.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.REMOTE_USER

cgi.request_method.body: Method with which the request was made. For HTTP, this is Get, Head, Post, and so on.

cgi.request_url.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.REQUEST_URL

cgi.script_name.body: Virtual path to the script that is executing; used for self-referencing URLs.

cgi.server_name.body: Server's hostname, DNS alias, or IP address as it appears in self-referencing URLs.

cgi.server_port.body: Port number to which the request was sent.

cgi.server_port_secure.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.SERVER_PORT_SECURE

cgi.server_protocol.body: Name and revision of the information protocol this request came in with. Format: protocol/revision.

cgi.server_software.body: Name and version of the information server software answering the request (and running the gateway). Format: name/version.

cgi.web_server_api.body: Sorry! No documentation is available for CGI.WEB_SERVER_API
